# The `LSRUse` Class Reference

<DoxygenPage pluginConfig={pluginConfig}>

This class holds the state that LSR keeps for each use in <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/ivusers">IVUsers</a>, as well as uses invented by LSR itself. <a href="#details">More...</a>

## Declaration

<CodeBlock>class anonymous_namespace{LoopStrengthReduce.cpp}::LSRUse</CodeBlock>

## Description {#details}

This class holds the state that LSR keeps for each use in <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/ivusers">IVUsers</a>, as well as uses invented by LSR itself.

It includes information about what kinds of things can be folded into the user, information about the user itself, and information about how the use may be satisfied. TODO: Represent multiple users of the same expression in common?

Definition at line 1308 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/scalar/loopstrengthreduce-cpp">LoopStrengthReduce.cpp</a>.

An enum for a kind of use, indicating what types of scaled and immediate operands it might support.

<EnumerationList title="Enumeration values">

<Link id="a1ba9c6c01c92aafaeb2986bdd756dcf0a55d63bad11e6c7c0a80a181ad353c0a4" />
<EnumerationListItem name="Basic">
A normal use, with no folding
</EnumerationListItem>

<Link id="a1ba9c6c01c92aafaeb2986bdd756dcf0ab2859f05059b7bc12a24c88a418fd214" />
<EnumerationListItem name="Special">
A special case of basic, allowing -1 scales
</EnumerationListItem>

<Link id="a1ba9c6c01c92aafaeb2986bdd756dcf0a83bf7174fbbec2c33ed1a665e637fd2a" />
<EnumerationListItem name="Address">
An address use; folding according to <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/targetlowering">TargetLowering</a>
</EnumerationListItem>

<Link id="a1ba9c6c01c92aafaeb2986bdd756dcf0aa25a0984500d71f1ab0f82f5372a4d70" />
<EnumerationListItem name="ICmpZero">
An equality icmp with both operands folded into one
</EnumerationListItem>

</EnumerationList>

### Formulae {#a8edee80f0644aef0363b9bc0a7593182}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>SmallVector&lt;Formula, 12&gt; anonymous&#95;namespace&#123;LoopStrengthReduce.cpp&#125;::LSRUse::Formulae</>}>
A list of ways to build a value that can satisfy this user.

After the list is populated, one of these is selected heuristically and used to formulate a replacement for OperandValToReplace in UserInst.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/scalar/loopstrengthreduce-cpp/#l01354">1354</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/scalar/loopstrengthreduce-cpp">LoopStrengthReduce.cpp</a>.

### MinOffset {#a445b231c7c14ab0d460f9a4d70367c8e}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>Immediate anonymous&#95;namespace&#123;LoopStrengthReduce.cpp&#125;::LSRUse::MinOffset = <a href="/docs/api/classes/anonymous-namespace-loopstrengthreduce-cpp-/immediate/#a23392dbe6d771d111f00d09560f87f0d">Immediate::getFixedMax</a>()</>}>
Keep track of the min and max offsets of the fixups.

### RigidFormula {#aa45af5caf29ddb4040ef123166ba800a}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool anonymous&#95;namespace&#123;LoopStrengthReduce.cpp&#125;::LSRUse::RigidFormula = false</>}>
RigidFormula is set to true to guarantee that this use will be associated with a single formulaâ€“the one that initially matched.

Some <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev">SCEV</a> expressions cannot be expanded. This allows LSR to consider the registers used by those expressions without the need to expand them later after changing the formula.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/scalar/loopstrengthreduce-cpp/#l01343">1343</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/scalar/loopstrengthreduce-cpp">LoopStrengthReduce.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### WidestFixupType {#ac6eb6d8e22eb1da2d816c5cb38fe166d}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>Type&#42; anonymous&#95;namespace&#123;LoopStrengthReduce.cpp&#125;::LSRUse::WidestFixupType = nullptr</>}>
This records the widest use type for any fixup using this <a href="/docs/api/classes/anonymous-namespace-loopstrengthreduce-cpp-/lsruse">LSRUse</a>.

FindUseWithSimilarFormula can&#39;t consider uses with different max fixup widths to be equivalent, because the narrower one may be relying on the implicit truncation to truncate away bogus bits.
